    About

    • About Otterbein
    • Visit Otterbein
    • Calendars
    • Newsroom
    • Community
    • Accreditation
    • Faculty
    • Leadership
    • Careers at Otterbein
    • University Recognition
    Otterbein University has a history as a national leader. In 1847, Otterbein was among the first universities to enroll women in courses alongside men. Today, Otterbein is leading the country in integrating real-life experiences with classroom learning to help each student grow as a whole person. We invite you to learn more about us.

    • Visit Otterbein
    • Consumer Information
    Are you looking for a college that’s right for you? Come on in and find out more about Otterbein University and our students. Talk with an admission counselor about everything we have to offer. Explore our majors, minors and graduate programs. Schedule a visit and see it for yourself. We can’t wait to meet you!

    Have you already decided that Otterbein is the place for you? Read more about the admission process and financial aid. We’ll see you in class!
  • Academics

    Academics

    • Majors & Minors
    • Departments
    • Schools and University Programs
    • Academic Affairs Division
    • Registrar
    • Five Cardinal Experiences
    • Enrichment Programs
    • Catalogs
    • Course Search
    • Academic Calendar
    With 73 majors, 44 minors, four master’s degrees and a doctor of nursing practice degree to choose from, Otterbein University is sure to have something for you.

    Otterbein offers unique learning opportunities. Working with area partners, Otterbein has developed programs like our post-master’s nurse anesthesia program with Grant Medical Center and our service-learning courses with local non-profit organizations.

    And that’s just the beginning. Check out everything from sustainability studies and chemistry to allied health and early childhood education, and everything in between.
  • Athletics

    Athletics

    • Cardinal News
    • www.otterbeincardinals.com
    • Recruiting
    Athletics is an important aspect of the college experience. Whether you become one of our many student-athletes, or a student rocking red in the stands, Otterbein will provide you with an arena to display your best. The Cardinals compete in one of the most competitive leagues in NCAA Division III, the Ohio Athletic Conference, where they have won more than 50 conference championships in the last decade. Our athletes have also remained sharp in the classroom, earning more than 100 academic and athletic honors last year alone. Last fall, our nationally-ranked women’s soccer team earned a trip to the Final Four while the women’s volleyball team made its first-ever appearance in the NCAA’s. The Cardinal football team advanced to the NCAA playoffs for the first time in 2008. Come to Otterbein and join a team of more than 500 student-athletes who study hard and play hard.
  • Campus Life

    Campus Life

    • Living on Campus
    • Student Life
    • Services and Resources
    • Health and Safety
    • Five Cardinal Experiences
    • Division of Student Affairs
    • Leadership
    There is always something to do on campus. Otterbein has weekly volunteer programs and regular social events for students, as well as a full calendar of cultural and educational opportunities open to the entire community. From theatre and music performances to lectures by international scholars, you might never have to leave campus.

    But you should, because the community has plenty to offer Otterbein students. Located in Westerville, a suburb of Ohio's capital city, Otterbein strikes a perfect balance between small-town charm and big-city opportunities. From museums and concerts to internships and volunteer opportunities, you'll find it all right here.
  • The Graduate School

    The Graduate School

    • MBA

    • Graduate Education Programs
    • Master of Science in Allied Health
    • Master of Arts in Educational Mathematics
    • Program Previews
    • International Admission
    • Graduate School Symposium
    • Audit a Class
    • Resources
    Do you want to advance your career? Otterbein University has many options for you. We offer master’s degree programs in business administration, education and nursing and a doctor of nursing practice degree program. We recognize the unique circumstances of working adults and work hard to make earning your degree easy and convenient. Learn more about The Graduate School at Otterbein today.

    Parents

    • News and Events
    • Future Parents and Family
    • Current Parents and Family
    As the parent or family member of a current or prospective Otterbein University student, you are bound to have questions about your student's college experience. We've provided the answers to some of the most commonly asked questions right here. We invite you to read more and contact us if you still have unanswered questions. We're here to help you!

    Even after you graduate, Otterbein has plenty of opportunities for you as an alumnus. From social gatherings and volunteer opportunities to domestic and international trips, we have something to interest each of our alumni. Take a look for yourself and get involved today!

  • MAT Student, Lacrosse Coach Hopes to Inspire Athletes
    During summers coaching youth in lacrosse, Will Wismer realized he wanted to become a teacher. He will receive his Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) on May 19.

  • Psychology Professor Teaches Textbook-Free Course
    Professor Noam Shpancer's course, “The Skills: Keys to Mental Resilience,” served as a textbook-free, all-digital course pilot during Otterbein's winter J-Term.
    / find out more
  • Allied Health Major Lands EMS Practicum, Completes Citizen's Academy
    Sophomore Jerrin Hill completed a field experience practicum with the Delaware County EMS, and participated in their seven-week Citizen's Academy.
    / find out more
  • Men's Golf Captures OAC Championship
    Otterbein University men’s golf captured the OAC Championships title Sunday by 11 strokes, and received an automatic bid to the NCAA Division III championships.
    / find out more
  • Otterbein's New Spring Alumni Weekend a Success
    Otterbein hosted the 2012 Alumni Weekend, April 27-29. More than 450 alumni returned to campus to participate in the events. Click below to see photos.

Check out Community News

Community is important to Otterbein. We value our relationships with our neighbors, partners and friends in Westerville and central Ohio. As a member of the community, we'll keep you updated about news and events that affect you, and we welcome you to see what's going on at Otterbein and get involved.
